popt4jlib.GradientDescent

Class VecUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.GradientDescent.VecUtil

  • public class VecUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for Vector computations.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

      returns the center of a collection of VectorIntf objects.
      static double getCosineSimilarityDistance(VectorIntf x, VectorIntf y)
      return the cosine-similarity between x and y (ie the cos(x/\y)) used in Information Retrieval.
      static double getEuclideanDistance(VectorIntf x, VectorIntf y)
      returns the Euclidean distance between two VectorIntf objects.

      return the Jaccard distance measure between two vectors.

      compute the inner product of two VectorIntf objects

      return the k-th norm of the vector x.

      short-cut for norm(x,2).

      computes the infinity norm of x.
      static VectorIntf subtract(VectorIntf x, VectorIntf y)
      return a new VectorIntf object that is the difference (x-y) of the two arguments.
      static int zeroNorm(VectorIntf x)
      computes the zero-norm of x (#non-zero components of x)

      • equal

        public static boolean equal(VectorIntf x,
            VectorIntf y)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        x - VectorIntf
        y - VectorIntf
        Returns:
        boolean true iff all the components of the vectors x and y are equal (so that for each component i, the comparison xi==yi returns true). Returns false if the two vectors have different lengths.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if x & y are both null

        Returns:

      • getCosineSimilarityDistance

        public static double getCosineSimilarityDistance(VectorIntf x,
                                 VectorIntf y)
                                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        return the cosine-similarity between x and y (ie the cos(x/\y)) used in Information Retrieval. This similarity measure is not a "distance" measure, as the more "similar" two vectors are, the greater the returned value of this method.
        Parameters:
        x - VectorIntf
        y - VectorIntf
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if x or y are null or if one of the two is the zero vector, or if the two vectors' dimensions don't agree.

      • getJaccardDistance

        public static double getJaccardDistance(VectorIntf x,
                        VectorIntf y)
                                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        return the Jaccard distance measure between two vectors. Also known as the Tanimoto distance measure (used in Information Retrieval, Recommender Systems etc.)
        Parameters:
        x - VectorIntf
        y - VectorIntf
        Returns:
        double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
